title: Calories in Pork Ribs
meta_description: Discover calories in ribs pork per 100 g serving, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
assumptions: Cooked pork spare ribs, bone-in, roasted without added sauce or seasonings; values exclude bone weight.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cut (spare vs. baby back), cooking method, sauce, and portion size. Check labels or sources for specifics.

quick_answer.text: 100 g of cooked pork ribs contains about 292 kcal and 23 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

tweaks.label: Add 2 tbsp BBQ sauce per 100 g
Baby back ribs instead of spare (leaner cut) per 100 g
Trim visible fat before cooking per 100 g

faqs.q: How many calories in 100 g pork ribs?
faqs.a: Approximately 292 kcal for cooked spare ribs without sauce.

faqs.q: What is the protein in pork ribs?
faqs.a: About 23 g protein per 100 g, making it a good source for muscle building.

faqs.q: Are pork ribs high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, around 22 g total fat per 100 g, with 8 g saturated.
Negligible carbs (0 g) unless sauce or breading is added.

faqs.q: How does cooking method affect calories in ribs pork?
faqs.a: Grilling or smoking adds minimal calories; frying or saucing increases them significantly.
